intro: Tordylium magnum, commonly known as the giant tordylium, is a striking member of the Araliaceae family native to the tropical regions of South America. This plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Tordylium magnum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can grow up to several meters in height under ideal conditions.
